data.name: DeleteCommandNeedsOptions
data.value: The command {0} needs at least one of the following options set: {1}

data.name: FailedToParseParametersFileError
data.value: Unable to read the parameters file "{0}", reason: {1}

data.name: FiltersCannotBeUsedWithFileError
data.value: Filters cannot be specified on the commandline if filters are also present in the parameter file

data.name: IntegerParseError
data.value: Unable to parse "{0}" into a number

data.name: InternalOptionUsedError
data.value: The option --{0} was supplied, but it is reserved for internal use and may not be set on the commandline

data.name: ParametersFileOptionLong
data.value: This option can be used to store some or all of the options given to the commandline client. The file must be a plain text file, UTF-8 encoding is preferred. Each line in the file should be of the format --option=value. The special options --source and --target can be used to override the localpath and the remote destination uri, respectively. The options in this file take precedence over the options provided on the commandline. You cannot specify filters in both the file and on the commandline.

data.name: ParametersFileOptionShort
data.value: Path to a file with parameters

data.name: TimeParseError
data.value: Unable to parse "{0}" into a time offset: {1}

data.name: UnhandledException
data.value: An error occured: {0}

data.name: UnhandledInnerException
data.value: The inner error message is: {0}

data.name: WrongNumberOfCommandsError_v2
data.value: Found {0} commands but expected {1}, commands: {2}

data.name: InvalidCommandError
data.value: Command not supported: {0}

data.name: SupportedBackendsHeader
data.value: Supported backends:

data.name: SupportedCompressionModulesHeader
data.value: Supported compression modules:

data.name: SupportedEncryptionModulesHeader
data.value: Supported encryption modules:

data.name: SupportedOptionsHeader
data.value: Supported options:

data.name: ModuleIsLoadedAutomatically
data.value: Module is loaded atomatically, use --disable-module to prevent this

data.name: ModuleIsNotLoadedAutomatically
data.value: Module is not loaded atomatically, use --enable-module to load it

data.name: GenericModulesHeader
data.value: Supported generic modules:

data.name: NoFilesetsMatching
data.value: No filesets matched the criteria

data.name: WouldDeleteBackups
data.value: The following filesets would be deleted:

data.name: DeletedBackups
data.value: These filesets were deleted:

data.name: IncludeLong
data.value: Include files that match this filter. The special character * means any number of character, and the special character ? means any single character, use *.txt to include all files with a txt extension. Regular expressions are also supported and can be supplied by using hard braces, i.e. [.*\.txt].

data.name: IncludeShort
data.value: Include files

data.name: ExcludeLong
data.value: Exclude files that match this filter. The special character * means any number of character, and the special character ? means any single character, use *.txt to include all files with a txt extension. Regular expressions are also supported and can be supplied by using hard braces, i.e. [.*\.txt].

data.name: ExcludeShort
data.value: Exclude files

data.name: ControlFilesOptionShort
data.value: If this option is used with a backup operation, it is interpreted as a list of files to add to the filesets. When used with list or restore, it will list or restore the control files instead of the normal files.

data.name: ControlFilesOptionLong
data.value: Use control files

data.name: QuietConsoleOptionLong
data.value: If this option is set, progress reports and other messages that would normally go to the console will be redirected to the log.

data.name: QuietConsoleOptionShort
data.value: Disable console output
